headline: Trade Desk Stock Jumps After Company Added to S&P 500
summary: The Trade Desk  will be added to the S&P 500 index prior to the opening of trading on Friday.  It will replace  Ansys  which is being purchased by S&P 500 constituent  Synopsys  on Thursday, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.  Shares of Trade Desk, which provides a platform for advertising buyers, were sharply higher in after-hours trading, gaining 14.6% to $86.41 after being little changed in regular trading Monday.

Shares of Trade Desk, which provides a platform for advertising buyers, were sharply higher in after-hours trading, gaining 14.6% to $86.41 after being little changed in regular trading Monday.

headline: The Trade Desk Set to Join S&P 500
summary: The Trade Desk Inc. (NASD: TTD) will replace ANSYS Inc. (NASD: ANSS) in the S&P 500 effective prior to the opening of trading on Friday, July 18. S&P 500 constituent Synopsys Inc. (NASD: SNPS) will acquire ANSYS in a deal expected to be completed on July 17.

headline: Wall Street Analysts Think The Trade Desk (TTD) Is a Good Investment: Is It?
summary: According to the average brokerage recommendation (ABR), one should invest in The Trade Desk (TTD). It is debatable whether this highly sought-after metric is effective because Wall Street analysts' recommendations tend to be overly optimistic. Would it be worth investing in the stock?
